name: Risk
description: Risk is a strategy board game of diplomacy, conflict and conquest for two to six players. The standard version is played on a board depicting a political map of the Earth, divided into forty-two territories, which are grouped into six continents.
basicRules: Players control armies with which they attempt to capture territories from other players.
The game is won by 'global domination', i.e., controlling all 42 territories on the board.
On your turn, you get reinforcements based on the number of territories you control, and for controlling entire continents.
You can then attack other players' territories. Attacks are resolved by rolling dice.
If you successfully capture a territory, you can move some of your armies into it.
At the end of your turn, you can fortify your position by moving armies between your connected territories.
tips: Controlling continents is key to getting more reinforcements.
Don't spread your armies too thin.
Forming alliances with other players can be a good strategy, but be careful who you trust.
